DataElement.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor based on pathologic findings using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor Pathologic N Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A low or intermediate grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.  According to the presence or absence of clinical syndromes that result from hormone hypersecretion, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are classified either as functional or nonfunctional._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A low or intermediate grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas

Concepts.definition: A well differentiated, low, intermediate, or high grade neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.  According to the presence or absence of clinical syndromes that result from hormone hypersecretion, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are classified either as functional or nonfunctional.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5-3-19 released; tmt. 3/21/19 curated for AJCC ed. 8 content; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of a pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors arising in the pancreas. It does not apply to carcinomas of the pancreas, including high-grade (grade 3), poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
